temporalfox joined #xwiki at 10:10  
temporalfox - (10:10): hi everyone  
temporalfox - (10:12): is there an easy way to parse a "plain" syntax that would however still container {{macro}} blocks only. I found the "plain" syntax existing in wiki parser, anyone has an advice to "add" the macro syntax parsing ?  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:17  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:18): temporalfox: I think "plain" is only an output syntax. I think you can however create your own syntax which is a subset of xwiki/2.0 containing only the macros. I don't know much about the rendering engine, you can get more info from tmortagne when he shows up.  
temporalfox - (10:18): there is a parser too  
temporalfox - (10:18): I'm only interested in parsing  
temporalfox - (10:19): PlainTextBlockParser  
temporalfox - (10:19): is therea a guide or something to customize the xwiki/2.0 syntax or just a track to follow ?  
temporalfox - (10:20): actually : PlainTextStreamParser for the parser

CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:47): evalica: Looking at http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Improvements/InvitationProposal/Inv3.png How did you get those 10px horizontal grey lines (below Email | Sent date...) Do you have a style sheet for the mockup?  
tmortagne - (10:50): CalebJamesDeLisl: did you received my message yesterday about impossibility to have a Configurable UI without the form and save button around it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:50): I did. That is not correct behavior. I might have broke it when I put in javascript to unify the save buttons.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:51): If so then disabling script will remove the button.  
tmortagne - (10:53): CalebJamesDeLisl: indeed i disabled js with noscript and i get my buttons now  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:54): The rule for when there is a save button should be: If the section exists prior to adding the Configurable object OR if (any of) the configurable object(s) defines a custom configuration class.  
SvenDowideit\_ joined #xwiki at 10:55  
tmortagne - (10:56): CalebJamesDeLisl: i have only one Configurable object without any custom configuration class in it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:56): Yes, that's my bad javascript going haywire.  
tmortagne - (10:56): you can reproduce easily by just having an empty Configurable object in some document with just the section configured

CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:59): Looks like the easy solution is to only pull in the jssx object if there are multiple forms.

mflorea - (16:20): tmortagne: I need a way to serialize an entity reference relative to a given entity reference. For instance, let's say I have [xwiki, Main, Alice] and [xwiki, Main, Bob]. I want to serialize Bob relative to Alex, and thus I want to obtain just "Bob". If I were to serialize Bob relative to [xwiki, Blog, Carol] I would expect to get "Main.Bob". I've looked in the xwiki-model but I couldn't find such a entity reference serializer..  
tmortagne - (16:21): mflorea: that is supported by all serializer, just give your base reference as second parameter  
mflorea - (16:21): hmm, let me check  
tmortagne - (16:22): not all serializer actually  
tmortagne - (16:22): all resolver but for serializer it's all except the default one  
tmortagne - (16:22): i think  
tmortagne - (16:22): let me see  
tmortagne - (16:23): well actually it's not the right way to see it  
mflorea - (16:23): but resolvers add missing parts, they don't remove shared parts, at least that's what I understood  
tmortagne - (16:24): giving base reference is supported by all serializer  
tmortagne - (16:24): but the you have to choose the serializer bahavior you want  
tmortagne - (16:24): do you want to compact oly wiki part or everything  
tmortagne - (16:25): so in your case it's "compact" serializer i think since you want the whole thing  
tmortagne - (16:25): and you give Alex reference as second parameter  
tmortagne - (16:25): niot second sorry, last parameter  
tmortagne - (16:25): an example will be better :) :  
tmortagne - (16:26): compactSerializer.serialize(bobReference, alexReference)  
mflorea - (16:26): I wan't to remove all the parts that are the same as in the base reference. If only the wiki si the same, then just the wiki should be omitted, if the space is the same too, then the space should be omitted too  
tmortagne - (16:26): and you use "compact" as serializer hint  
tmortagne - (16:27): mflorea: most of the serializer/resolver implementations are in xwiki-core  
mflorea - (16:27): oh, I was looking in the xwiki-model  
mflorea - (16:27): that's why I haven't seen the compact serializer  
tmortagne - (16:27): but giving a base reference is supported by all serializer/resolvers anyway  
mflorea - (16:27): sure  
tmortagne - (16:27): so it's only about what you want to remove  
mflorea - (16:28): ok, let me try the compact serializer  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 16:50  
mflorea - (16:55): tmortagne: the compact serializer works great, thanks!  
tmortagne - (16:55): mflorea: np :)

silviar left at 17:16 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne - (17:21): what is the best way to split a string into a List<String> in velocity ? String.split produce array and i don't know how to convert an array into List (except using a #foreach of course)  
tmortagne - (17:22): (a need a List because i want to call a java methods that takes a List)  
tmortagne - (17:42): answering to myself, here is one way:  
tmortagne - (17:42): #set($myarray = $mystring..split(','))  
tmortagne - (17:42): #set($list = $myarray.subList(0, $myarray.length))  
tmortagne - (17:43): this is possible because since velocity 1.6 arrays support all lists methods (but are not automatically converted to list when calling java methods), here it's subList called on an array  
tmortagne - (17:46): actualy it's:  
tmortagne - (17:46): #set($myarray = $mystring..split(','))  
tmortagne - (17:46): #set($list = $myarray.subList(0, $myarray.size()))
